meanings.definition: To run at a steady, gentle pace
meanings.sent1: She jogs around the park every morning.
meanings.sent2: He usually jogs for thirty minutes before breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The dog jogs happily beside its owner.
meanings.sent4: Time jogs along slowly when you're waiting for something.
meanings.sent5: The river jogs gently through the meadow.

meanings.definition: A brief period of running at a steady, gentle pace
meanings.sent1: My favorite part of the race is the final jog to the finish line.
meanings.sent2: After a short jog, she felt refreshed and energized.
meanings.sent3: The jog in the park was a nice break from work.
meanings.sent4: The jog of the deer through the forest was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The jog around the block helped clear his mind.

meanings.sent1: She jogs my elbow to get my attention.
meanings.sent2: He jogs the door open with his shoulder.
meanings.sent3: The wind jogs the leaves on the tree.
meanings.sent4: The boat jogs against the dock as the waves hit.
meanings.sent5: The cat jogs the toy mouse with its paw.

meanings.sent1: I felt a gentle jog on my shoulder.
meanings.sent2: He gave the door a quick jog with his hip.
meanings.sent3: The jog of the table against the wall made a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The jog of the car as it hit the curb startled me.
meanings.sent5: She felt a jog on her arm as someone passed by.
